DOC.brief_title: Reducing Preterm Births Underserved Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim proposal test efficacy clinic-based , computer-assisted intervention system significantly reduce preterm birth high-risk population . This system : ( 1 ) ass pregnant woman 's unique risk six modifiable area associate increased risk preterm birth include smoke cessation , poor nutrition , domestic violence , maternal depression stress , urinary reproductive tract infection substance use ; ( 2 ) provide tailor advice action planning tool reduce risk ; ( 3 ) provide certify nurse midwife physician information relate assessed risk counsel suggestion tailor need , [ ( 4 ) promote effective referral , successful linkages community-based support organization . ] Because preterm birth rate much high underserved African American woman , propose focus intervention population .
DOC.criteria: Study inclusion criterion include : 1. age 1648 year , 2 . 1st trim pregnancy , 3. race/ethnicity ( nonHispanic Black , Englishspeaking Hispanic Black ) , 4 ) selfreported completion grade 6 high . Exclusion criterion include : 1. medical condition risk pregnancy physician nurse midwife determines serious reason exclusion , 2. literacy level < grade 6 . No prior experience use computer need .
